newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Portugal says Blair win victory for new Socialism.
newsitem.headline: Portugal says Blair win victory for new Socialism.

text.p: Portuguese Prime Minister Antonio Guterres, a Socialist, congratulated Tony Blair on Friday on his crushing victory in Britain's general election, calling it a triumph for a new type of Socialist idealism in Europe.

"This is not only a great victory for you but also for the new Socialist ideals and for the social emphasis on the construction of Europe," Guterres said in a personal message to the Labour Party leader.
Portugal's Socialist Party won power in a parliamentary election in 1995 also after suffering a long period in opposition during which it shed much of its left-wing dogma.
Blair's victory took the Labour Party back to power in Britain for the first time since 1979.
"There is a great similarity in points of view between the 'New Labour' and the Portuguese Socialists," Guterres said.
He added that he looked forward to a period of "closer and deeper" cooperation between their governments, particularly on issues relating to the European Union of which both are members.
"Portugal needs a United Kingdom deeply committed, like us, to the construction of Europe," he said.
